pullRequest.title: [BEAM-11046] Update Snowflake docs about supporting AWS/S3
pullRequest.bodyText:
Update for Snowflake docs about supporting AWS/S3

Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 Choose reviewer(s) and mention them in a comment (R: @username).
 Format the pull request title like [BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles, where you replace BEAM-XXX with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.
 Update CHANGES.md with noteworthy changes.
 If this contribution is large, please file an Apache Individual Contributor License Agreement.

See the Contributor Guide for more tips on how to make review process smoother.

nodes.bodyText:
nit: this still references gcp, it should probably be my_bucket. It'd be nice if all of the example bucket names were the same.
I'd also make it {gs,s3}://my_bucket to be a little more concise, but I'm fine with it as-is as well.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -213,8 +213,8 @@ To pass Pipeline options via the command line, use `-DintegrationTestPipelineOpt
       Example: --database=TEST_DATABASE
   "--storageIntegrationName=<SNOWFLAKE STORAGE INTEGRATION NAME>",
       Example: --storageIntegrationName=my_integration
-  "--stagingBucketName=<GCS BUCKET NAME>",
-      Example: --stagingBucketName=gs://my_gcp_bucket
+  "--stagingBucketName=<GCS OR S3 BUCKET NAME>",
+      Example: --stagingBucketName=<gs or s3>://my_gcp_bucket
